verses.text_plain: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 1Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.

verses.text_plain: The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up.
verses.verse_html: 2The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up.

verses.text_plain: For thus saith the Lord God; The city that went out by a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 3For thus saith the Lord God; The city that went out by a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.

verses.text_plain: For thus saith the Lord unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:
verses.verse_html: 4For thus saith the Lord unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:

tokens.text: ye me, and ye shall live

verses.text_plain: But seek not Beth–el, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beer–sheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Beth–el shall come to nought.
verses.verse_html: 5But seek not Beth–el, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beer–sheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Beth–el shall come to nought.

verses.text_plain: Seek the Lord, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in Beth–el.
verses.verse_html: 6Seek the Lord, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in Beth–el.

verses.text_plain: Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in the earth,
verses.verse_html: 7Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in the earth,

verses.text_plain: Seek him that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The Lord is his name:
verses.verse_html: 8Seek him that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The Lord is his name:

verses.text_plain: That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.
verses.verse_html:
9That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress. ▼
▼ spoiled: Heb. spoil

verses.text_plain: They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.
verses.verse_html: 10They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.

verses.text_plain: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them.
verses.verse_html:
11Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them. ▼
▼ pleasant…: Heb. vineyards of desire

footnotes.body_html: ▼ pleasant…: Heb. vineyards of desire

verses.text_plain: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.
verses.verse_html:
12For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right. ▼
▼ a bribe: or, a ransom

footnotes.body_html: ▼ a bribe: or, a ransom

verses.text_plain: Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.
verses.verse_html: 13Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.

verses.text_plain: Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the Lord, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.
verses.verse_html: 14Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the Lord, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.

tokens.text: shall be with you, as ye have spoken

verses.text_plain: Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be that the Lord God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.
verses.verse_html: 15Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be that the Lord God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.

tokens.text: it may be that the Lord

verses.text_plain: Therefore the Lord, the God of hosts, the Lord, saith thus; Wailing shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.
verses.verse_html: 16Therefore the Lord, the God of hosts, the Lord, saith thus; Wailing shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.

verses.text_plain: And in all vineyards shall be wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 17And in all vineyards shall be wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith the Lord.

verses.text_plain: Woe unto you that desire the day of the Lord! to what end is it for you? the day of the Lord is darkness, and not light.
verses.verse_html: 18Woe unto you that desire the day of the Lord! to what end is it for you? the day of the Lord is darkness, and not light.

verses.text_plain: As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.
verses.verse_html: 19As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.

verses.text_plain: Shall not the day of the Lord be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?
verses.verse_html: 20Shall not the day of the Lord be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?

verses.text_plain: I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.
verses.verse_html:
21I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies. ▼
▼ in…: or, your holy days

footnotes.body_html: ▼ in…: or, your holy days

verses.text_plain: Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept them: neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.
verses.verse_html:
22Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept them: neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts. ▼
▼ peace…: or, thank offerings

footnotes.body_html: ▼ peace…: or, thank offerings

verses.text_plain: Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.
verses.verse_html: 23Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.

verses.text_plain: But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.
verses.verse_html:
24But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream. ▼
▼ run: Heb. roll

verses.text_plain: Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
verses.verse_html: 25Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?

verses.text_plain: But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.
verses.verse_html:
26But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves. ▼
▼ the tabernacle…: or, Siccuth your king

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the tabernacle…: or, Siccuth your king
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the tabernacle…: or, Siccuth your king

verses.text_plain: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the Lord, whose name is The God of hosts.
verses.verse_html: 27Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the Lord, whose name is The God of hosts.

tokens.text: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity
